# C++ Qt API client

# 

SpectroCoin Merchant

- API version: 1.0.0
- Generator version: 7.9.0

This is an API designed for merchants who are using SpectroCoin services and wishes to integrate them locally.


*Automatically generated by the [OpenAPI Generator](https://openapi-generator.tech)*


## Requirements

Building the API client library requires:

1. CMake 3.2+
2. Qt
3. C++ Compiler

## Getting Started

example.h:
```c++

#include <iostream>
#include "../client/OAICreateOrderApi.h"

using namespace test_namespace;

class Example : public QObject {
    Q_OBJECT
    qint64 create();
    qint64 create();
    QString create();
    QString create();
    QString create();
    QString create();
    QString create();
    QString create();
    QString create();
    QString create();
    double create();
    QString create();
    QString create();
    QString create();
    double create();
    QString create();
public Q_SLOTS:
   void exampleFunction1();
};

```

example.cpp:
```c++

#include "../client/OAICreateOrderApi.h"
#include "example.h"
#include <QTimer>
#include <QEventLoop>

qint64 Example::create(){
    qint64 obj;
qint64 Example::create(){
    qint64 obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
double Example::create(){
    double obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
double Example::create(){
    double obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
 return obj;
}

void Example::exampleFunction1(){
     OAICreateOrderApi apiInstance;
     
      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAICreateOrderApi::createOrderSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAICreateOrderApi::createOrderSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      qint64 api_id = create(); // qint64 | API ID of specific API you have configured on your merchant account

      QEventLoop loop;

          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAICreateOrderApi::createOrderSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      qint64 merchant_id = create(); // qint64 | Merchant ID assigned to your account

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAICreateOrderApi::createOrderSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAICreateOrderApi::createOrderSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();

          loop.quit();
      });

      QString callback_url = create(); // QString | Url of merchant endpoint callback about order status to be returned

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAICreateOrderApi::createOrderSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAICreateOrderApi::createOrderSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {

      connect(&apiInstance, &OAICreateOrderApi::createOrderSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      QString description = create(); // QString | Order description. Will be presented for merchant customer at payment window

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAICreateOrderApi::createOrderSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAICreateOrderApi::createOrderSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      QString failure_url = create(); // QString | Url of merchant page customer should be redirected after unsuccessful payment

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAICreateOrderApi::createOrderSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAICreateOrderApi::createOrderSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {

          loop.quit();
      });

      QString order_id = create(); // QString | Custom order ID. Must be unique per API. If not provided it will be generated.

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAICreateOrderApi::createOrderSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAICreateOrderApi::createOrderSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      double pay_amount = create(); // double | Pay amount in pay currency of value which should be paid by merchant customer. If not provided receive amount will be used to calculate pay amount

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAICreateOrderApi::createOrderSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAICreateOrderApi::createOrderSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {

          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;

      });

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAICreateOrderApi::createOrderSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAICreateOrderApi::createOrderSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      double receive_amount = create(); // double | Receive amount in receive currency of value that merchant will be funded after merchant customers payment approval. If not provided pay amount will be used to calculate receive amount

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAICreateOrderApi::createOrderSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAICreateOrderApi::createOrderSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      QString success_url = create(); // QString | Url of merchant page customer should be redirected after successful payment
      apiInstance.createOrder(api_idmerchant_idpay_currencyreceive_currencysigncallback_urlculturedescriptionfailure_urlorder_idpay_amountpayer_emailpayer_namepayer_surnamereceive_amountsuccess_url);
      QTimer::singleShot(5000, &loop, &QEventLoop::quit);
      loop.exec();
  }

```

## Documentation for Servers

Parameterized Servers are supported. Define a server in the API for each endpoint with arbitrary numbers of variables:

```yaml
servers:
- url: http://{server}:{port}/{basePath}
  description: Description of the Server
  variables:
    server:
        enum:
          - 'petstore'
          - 'qa-petstore'
          - 'dev-petstore'
        default: 'petstore'
    port:
      enum:
        - '3000'
        - '1000'
      default: '3000'
    basePath:
      default: v1
```
To change the default variable, use this function in each Api:
```c++
int setDefaultServerValue(int serverIndex,const QString &operation, const QString &variable,const QString &val);
```
The parameter "serverIndex" will choose a server from the server list for each endpoint. There is always at least one server with index 0. The Parameter "operation" should be the desired endpoint operationid.
Variable is the name of the variable you wish to change and the value is the new default Value.
The function will return -1 when the variable does not exists, -2 if value is not defined in the variable enum and -3 if the operation is not found.

If your endpoint has multiple server objects in the servers array, you can set the server that will be used with this function:
```c++
void setServerIndex(const QString &operation, int serverIndex);
```
Parameter "operation" should be your operationid. "serverIndex" is the index you want to set as your default server. The function will check if there is a server with your index.
Here is an example of multiple servers in the servers array. The first server will have index 0 and the second will have index 1.
```yaml
servers:
- url: http://{server}:8080/
  description: Description of the Server
  variables:
    server:
        enum:
          - 'petstore'
          - 'qa-petstore'
          - 'dev-petstore'
        default: 'petstore'
- url: https://localhost:8080/v1
```

All endpoints do not require authorization.
